solution_line_template: The second cat meowed twice as frequently as the three meows per minute from the first cat, for a total of {second_cat_multiplier}*{first_cat_meows_per_minute}=<<{second_cat_multiplier}*{first_cat_meows_per_minute}={second_cat_meows_per_minute}>>{second_cat_meows_per_minute} meows per minute.

The third cat meowed at one-third the frequency of the second cat, for a total of {second_cat_meows_per_minute}/{third_cat_divisor}=<<{second_cat_meows_per_minute}/{third_cat_divisor}={third_cat_meows_per_minute}>>{third_cat_meows_per_minute} meows per minute.

Thus, combined, the three cats meow {first_cat_meows_per_minute}+{second_cat_meows_per_minute}+{third_cat_meows_per_minute}=<<{first_cat_meows_per_minute}+{second_cat_meows_per_minute}+{third_cat_meows_per_minute}={combined_meows_per_minute}>>{combined_meows_per_minute} times per minute.
In five minutes, the three cats meow {minutes}*{combined_meows_per_minute}=<<{minutes}*{combined_meows_per_minute}={total_meows}>>{total_meows} times.
